SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The general settings of the application. The name of the application will be used to generate the name of the zip file when using "Save parameter files" button in ConfigEditor (recommend to use unique name for one installation).
Language codes: hungarian=hu-HU(language id=1038=0x040e); US-english=en-US(language id=1033=0x0409) (other language codes may exist in the system).

The parameters:
>>> ApplicationName=the name of the application
>>> LanguageCode=this is the default language for the assembly line terminals (ASE)
>>> DisplayMissingItems=True: Display missing items in Config Editor with !!!NotFound!!! content (use this when testing)
>>> DisplayMissingItems=False: Do not display missing items in Config Editor (use this in working application)
>>> LanguageChangeAtLoginOnly=if true, then language change is available only on the login screen, otherwise on every screen.

Setting.SettingDescription: ASE terminal User Interfac default language (en-US format).
WEB/PC User Interface default language (hu-HU format).
Display missing items in ConfigEditor with !!!NotFound!!! content.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The report settings of the application.; For reports on large databases longer timout may be necessary, but in this case in no-connection situations the error message comes later.

The parameters:
>>> SQLTimeout=the timout value (seconds) for the client program to wait for the SQL server response

Here you can assign the ASE terminal sensors to sensor-event names on the assembly line. Assembly line terminals (ASE) have 8 sensors, numbered from left to right. Sensor assignment means setting a number, that when displayed as binary the '1' digit will show the position of the sensor (example: number=2 as binary 00000010, that indicates the sensor #7; number=8 as binary 00001000, that indicates the sensor #5).

The parameters (DTM/ALM events):
>>> diCYCLE=this is the name of the cycle signal indicating that one assembly board is passing by
>>> diON=this is the name of the on signal indicating that the assembly line is starting to operate
>>> dSiIV1/2/3/4=name of the other events that the incoming sensor signals can raise
>>> dBiIV1/2=name of the other events that the incoming push button signals can raise

For every event you have to specify the following:
>>> ASEname=Start or End (only the names of the listed ASE terminals are valid here)
>>> type=sensor or button (the event is connected to an ASE push button signal or a sensor signal)
>>> value=then number of the sensor/push button
>>> edge=signal level change that raises the even (01=from low to high, 10=from high to low)

Setting.SettingDescription: Signal change type of sensor/push button.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
In the system different beep sequences can indicate different events.

For every beeb sequence the following should be specified:
>>> Duration=the length of the beep sequence, if empty, then until explicit cancel command
>>> Repeat=the number of repetitions of the beep sequence
>>> BeepVolume=the volume of the beep sequence (1-50)
>>> BeepFrequency=the frequency of the beeps (recommended:1500-3000Hertz)
>>> BeepLen=Length of one beep (mp/100)
>>> InterBeepGap=gap between the beeps (mp/10).
>>> NumOfBeeps=number of beeps.

Interventions can be executed from the assembly line terminals (ASE). With these parameters you can define if authentication is needed in the system, and how.

The parameters:
>>> InterventionAuthenticationMode=None: no need for login authentication
>>> InterventionAuthenticationMode=OneTime: the login valid only for one intervention
>>> InterventionAuthenticationMode=Normal: the login valid for multiple intervention, log out is with the Logout intervention
>>> InterventionLoginExpire=the login will expire after a certain time (true/false)
>>> InterventionLoginExpireTime=if the login expires, then this is after how much time (min)
>>> InterventionLoginPasswordRequired=beside the username you need to use the user password in the Login intervention (true/false)

Setting.DisplayName: ASE login expire after this time
Setting.SettingDescription: ASE login expire after this time (minutes).

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
You can set the parameters of the interventions here.

>>> AutoID=intervention access code for barcode scanner (data from ASE RS232 port) (alphanumeric data, #$IVXX for recommended)
>>> KeyCode=intervention access code for keyboard on ASE USB port (two digits number)
>>> SensorEvent=Intervention sensor event name (values: IOIntervention1/2/3/4)
>>> ButtonEvent=Number of the ASE button the intervention is assigned to (values: 1/2/0; 0 means no assignment)
>>> AuthenticatedOnly=Authentication is required to execute the intervention (values: true/false)
>>> NeededRole=If authentication is required, then this is the role the user must have to execute the intervention
>>> ParameterSeparator=for multi parameter interventions this is the character that separates the parameters in AutoId intervention commands (barcodes)

Setting.SettingDescription: Name of the event assigned to one ASE intgrated button, that activates intervention *.
Name of the event assigned to one ASE sensor, that activates intervention *.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The ASE terminals will connect to the server IP address and the "Listen port" set here.
The server will identify the ASE terminals according to the Identification mode You set here.

The parameters:
>>> PClistenPort=the ASE terminals will connect to this port of the server computer
>>> IdentifiedBy = IP: ASE terminals are identified by their IP address
>>> IdentifiedBy = ID: ASE terminals are identified by their name asigned to them by the user
>>> ASEHeartbeatInterval: ASE heartbeat frequency in tenth of a second (0 means heartbeat is switched off)
>>> HeartBeatTimeOut: ASE-MW delays reaction to not recieved heartbeat with this number of milliseconds
>>> HDMIHeartBeatInterval: time between heartbeats sent by ASE-MW (sec/10) (0 means HDMI heartbeat function is disabled)
>>> HDMIHeartBeatTimeout: the tolerance time that the ASE terminals waits after the heartbeat timout expired; HDMIHeartBeatInterval+HDMIHeartBeatTimeout must be between 1-255

Setting.DisplayName: Server Listen port number waiting for ASE connection

SettingGroup.GroupHeading: ASE SENSOR/CONTROL terminals - Assembly lines assignment
SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The ASE SENSOR/CONTROL terminals are defined here for the assembly lines.
Currently 48 assembly lines can be defined in one system (ids: AS01-AS48).
If more needed, then reconfiguration is neccessary (only the system supplier can do it).
The identifier used in the names (ASnn) of the parameters will connect this setting to the Assembly Line Master Data in the system database. If You want to use the assembly line in the system, then - beside properly setting the parameters on this screen - it is mandatory to activate the Assembly line in the Assembly Line Master Data too!

The parameters for every assembly lines are:
>>> ASnn Inuse=set to true if you want to use start SENSOR/CONTROL ASE terminal driver software for the assembly line (mandatory, if you want to use ALM with the assembly line)
>>> ASnn Display name=this name will appear on this screen only
>>> ASnn AseID-End=ID of the primary ASE terminal of the assembly line

Setting.DisplayName: Assembly line * is used in this system
Setting.SettingDescription: Assembly line * is used in this system.

Setting.DisplayName: ASE End terminál id for assembly line *
Setting.SettingDescription: ASE End terminál IP or ID for assembly line *.

SettingGroup.GroupHeading: ASE MONITOR terminals - Assembly lines assignment
SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The ASE MONITOR terminals are defined here for the assembly lines.
Currently 48 assembly lines can be defined in one system (ids: AS01-AS48).
If more needed, then reconfiguration is neccessary (only the system supplier can do it).
The identifier used in the names (ASnn) of the parameters will connect this setting to the Assembly Line Master Data in the system database. If You want to use the assembly line in the system, then - beside properly setting the parameters on this screen - it is mandatory to activate the Assembly line in the Assembly Line Master Data too!

The parameters for every assembly lines are:
>>> ASnn Inuse=set to true if you want to start ASE MONITOR terminal driver software for the assembly line
>>> ASnn Display name=this name will appear on this screen only

>>> ASnn Ase-HDMI#1/2/3/4-ID=ID of the ASE #1/2/3/4 terminal
>>> ASnn Ase-HDMI#1/2/3/4-ScreenDescriptor=the name of the file and desriptor block of the HDMI screen to display on ASE #1/2/3/4 terminal

>>> ASE #1 usually drives the overhead monitor TV, while ASE#2 is the vertically positioned shift production summary TV at the end of the line)

Setting.DisplayName: Assembly line * is used in this system
Setting.SettingDescription: Assembly line * is used in this system.

Setting.DisplayName: * Ase-HDMI#1 is in use for assembly line *
Setting.SettingDescription: * Ase-HDMI#1 is in use for assembly line *.

Setting.SettingDescription: * Ase-HDMI#1 screen name for assembly line *.

Setting.SettingDescription: * Ase-HDMI#2 is in use for assembly line *.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
Here You can set the SMTP e-mail connection of the ALM application.\mailDeliveryMethod=method of e-mail delivery.
mailDeliveryFrom=the sender e-mail address in the e-mails sent from the system.\mailHost=name of the e-mail server.
mailUsername=username used by the system to log in the e-mail server.
mailUserPassword=user password used by the system to log in the e-mail server..
mailPort=port number used to send e-mails through (usually 25).
mailSSLenable=SSL enabled for e-mail sending (true/false).

Here You can set the parameters for the Web Monitor components.
RrefreshIntervalMatrix1=Web Monitor 1DMatrix elements refresh frequency.
RrefreshIntervalMatrix2D=Web Monitor 2DMatrix elements refresh frequency.
RrefreshIntervalTD=Web Monitor TrendDiagram element refresh frequency.
TDxxxxColor=Trend Diagram column colors.

Assembly line groups can be defined to allow the WebMonitor function to display assembly line information for a group of lines. There are 10 predefined groups (more can be created if neccessary). In this configuration screen search codes and display names can be defined for these groups. The search code will be used to select assembly lines where the same code is set in the Monitor group field of the assembly line master data (more codes can be defined for one line in the master data, separated by comma), the display name will be used in the dropdown list in the WebMonitor user interface to help the user find the appropriate group of lines.

For example let's define the following two assembly line groups: (searchcode=NISSAN, displayname=Nissan lines); (searchcode=LEFTDOOR, displayname=Left side door harnesses). If you set 'NISSAN,LEFTDOOR' for one line in the Monitor group field of its master data then this line will be included in the WebMonitor screen when you select the 'Nissan lines' or the 'Left side door harnesses' group of lines to display.

SearchCode: the search code (use UNUSED, if dont want to use this group).
DisplayName: the display name.

Setting.DisplayName: * group display name in dropdown list
Setting.SettingDescription: * group display name in dropdown list.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The system can identify the data recieved from the ASE terminals using the mask information set here.The identified data then will be converted and transmitted as if that arrived in that converted format from the ASE terminal.
More than one datamasks can be defined with the following parameters:
Inport = source port of the data; ASE terminal port (COM1/COM2).
Indata = format of the incoming data (regular expression).
Outdata = the converted (output) data format description, that refers to the named group used in the Indata regular expression.
 nameseparator = these are the bracket characters used in the Outdata format expression to bracket the named group names.

Setting.DisplayName: * - ASE source port of the incoming data
Setting.SettingDescription: ASE source port of the incoming data.

Setting.DisplayName: * - input mask of the incoming data
Setting.SettingDescription: Input mask of the incoming data.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The setings here describe the cooperation of ALM and CabPack..
Message format:
 [MessagePrefix][AssemblyLine]
[IVIDSeparator][IVID]
[ParameterSeparator][Parameter1][ParameterSeparator][Parameter2][ParameterSeparator][Parameter3]
[MessageSuffix]
[AssemblyLine]=the id or name (from the MasterData) of that assembly line the message is related to.
IP = ALM is waiting for CabPack connection on this IP address.
Port = ALM is waiting for CabPack connection on this Port.
MessagePrefix = All messages should start with this prefix.
MessageSuffix = All messages should end with this suffix.
IVIDSeparator = the separator string between the intervention id and the parameters.
ParameterSeparator = separator string between the parameters of the intervention.
Ack = Positive acknoledgement string sent back to CabPack.
If the above strings start with the [backslash]x characters, then the content is in hexadecimal format; for example [backslash]x0D0A are the CR-LF characters.
The following parameters are required to set for every message (MSG#n):
MessageId = The [IVID] string.
Intervention = The name of the intervention.

The logging parameters of the application. When changed, the system has to be restarted.
ASE MW LogLevel=None (no logging), All (full logging) and Default (use default logging setting).
ALM DC LogLevel=None (no logging),Error, Warning, Information vagy Verbose(full logging). The values are hierarchical; for example the Warning level includes all logs for the Error level.
LogFilePath=Log files are stored in this directory (here you will see the name of the actual log file, but you can overwrite this with the directory name only).
LogFileMaxSize=Maximal size of one log file (when exceeded, new one will start).

Setting.DisplayName: ASE MW datacollection server log level
Setting.SettingDescription: ASE MW datacollection server log level.

Setting.DisplayName: ALM application frame (DataController ASEMON) log level
Setting.SettingDescription: ALM application frame (DataController ASEMON) log level.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The system automatically will register downtime/over production status in certain situations. If you create the records for the automatic reason codes in the web userinterface DTR MasterData file, then you can use comprehensive descriptions for them.

The parameters:
>>> DTR_LateShiftStart=this is used when the assembly line is off at the time of the shift start (positive downtime is calculated).
>>> DTR_LateBreakEnd=this is used when the assembly line is off when the production should start after the breaktime (positive downtime is calculated).
>>> DTR_EarlyShiftEnd=this is used when the assembly line is switched off before the shift end (positive downtime is calculated).
>>> DTR_EarlyBreakStart=this is used when the assembly line is switched off before the break starts (positive downtime is calculated).
>>> DTR_ProductionEarlyStart=this is used, when the assembly line switched on before the breaktime ends (negative downtime is calculated).
>>> DTR_ProductionLateEnd=this is used, when the assembly line switched on after the breaktime starts (negative downtime is calculated).
>>> DTR_ShortDowntimePeriode=this is used, when the length of the downtime periode is shorter, than a limit.
>>> DTR_ShortDowntimePeriodeTimeLimit=the time limit for the DTR_ShortDowntimePeriode automatic downtime code.

If you experience delay in the cycle time countdown of the ALM system, displayed on the overhead monitor above the assembly line, compared to the realtime countdown counter of the assembly line, then you can set this parameter to compensate for this. Setting this parameter to 5 (seconds), then the ALM system cycle time counter will start counting backwards from the actual cycletime, measured between the last two assembly board, from the cycle time less 5.
>>> ASEMonitorCycleStartDelay=This is the delay (in seconds) of the cycle time countdown counter to start compared to the realtime counter of the assembly line.

The product completion intervention parameters are set here.
The Product complete intervention mode can be manual or automatic. In manual mode every single product completed has to be manually indicated to the system (using the push button). In automatic mode in every cycle one (or more) product is recorded in the system, the operator has to indicate manually only if this condition is not true, (that is empty board is passing by, or the harness is not taken off the board, or the harness has quality problems and is not directed to the tester workstation).
The number of items produced in one cycle can be set for all the assembly lines (common qty), and individually for those assembly lines, where the quantity is different from the common qty).
In manual mode beep sequence warns the operator not to forget to push the button to indicate product completion. The beep sequence starts with one beep (#1), that i is followed by another one (#2).
The system response with a confirmation beep to the operator to indicate if the product completion intervention was properly processed.

The parameters are the following:
>>> AutoProductCountMode=True (automatic), or False (manual).
>>> ItemCompletedInOneCycleQty=the number of items produced in one cycle.
>>> Signalname=the name of the beep sequence, assigned to the event.
>>> Afterinseconds=the start time of the beep sequence (in the % of the cycle time).

Setting.DisplayName: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #1 name.
Setting.SettingDescription: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #1 name.

Setting.DisplayName: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #1 start time.
Setting.SettingDescription: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #1 start time.

Setting.DisplayName: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #2 name
Setting.SettingDescription: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #2 name.

Setting.DisplayName: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #2 start time
Setting.SettingDescription: Product completed intervention warning beep signal #2 start time.

Setting.DisplayName: Product completed confirmation beep signal name
Setting.SettingDescription: Product completed confirmation beep signal name.

Setting.DisplayName: Product completed confirmation beep signal start time
Setting.SettingDescription: Product completed confirmation beep signal start time.

Setting.DisplayName: Number of completed items in one cycle
Setting.SettingDescription: Number of completed items in one cycle.

Setting.DisplayName: Number of completed items in one cycle on assembly line *
Setting.SettingDescription: Number of completed items in one cycle on assembly line *.

SettingGroup.GroupHeading: Flow parameters - Suspend / resume at shift start
SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
Suspending and/or resuming assembly line operation at shift start is controlled by these parameters. At shift start the suspend/NOT suspend parameters are evaluated first, and the assembly line suspend/resume status is set for the new shift.

The parameters:
>>> AutoSuspendShiftStart=true: if the assembly line is NOT suspended, but the starting shift IS, then the assembly line will move to suspended state.
>>> AutoResumeShiftStart=true: if the assembly line IS suspended, but the starting shift is NOT, then the assembly line will resume back to NOT suspended state.
>>> AutoResumeEWSexists=true: if the assembly line IS suspended at shift change, and there is an EWS for the starting shift, then the assembly line will resume to NOT suspended state (for both suspended and NOT suspended starting shifts).

Setting.DisplayName: Resume if EWS exists at shift start
Setting.SettingDescription: Resume if EWS exists at shift start.

SettingGroup.GroupHeading: Flow parameters - EWS execution at shift start
SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
EWS execution is controlled by these parameters. At shift start the suspend/NOT suspend parameters are evaluated first, and the assembly line suspend/resume status is set. If the assembly line new state is NOT suspended, then the EWS execution mode parameters are evaluated: if there is active EWS on the assembly line, and if the execution mode is continues, then EWS execution will continue. If the execution mode is not continous, then the EWS will not continue, but if at the same time automatic EWS start is set, the EWS for the starting shift (if exist) will start.

The parameters:
>>> EwsExecutionModeAutostart=true: EWS mode will automatically start if there is an e-worksheet available for the shift about to start.
>>> EwsExecutionModeContinous=true: the execution of the active e-worksheet will continue at shift change.
>>> EwsExecutionModeContinous=false: the execution will continue from the beginning of the e-worksheet available for the shift that is about to start (if no e-worksheet, thene EWS execution mode will stop).

SettingGroup.GroupHeading: Flow parameters - Shift Production Plan execution settings
SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
The ProductionStart,ProductionEnd,Packaging and PackagingClose settings control which interventions are active among those, related to the Shift Production Plan Monitoring. Setting value = True means the system will book the intervention only if it is exlicitly/manually executed. Setting value = False means the intervention is not executed explicitly, its booking is automatic, and related to other events in the system. For example ProductionStart=False means that the system will book this intervention together with the ProductionEnd intervention.
>>> SPMFactIVEnableProductionStart: Start of production of one item on the assembly line.
>>> SPMFactIVEnableProductionEnd: End of production of one item on the assembly line.
>>> SPMFactIVEnablePackaging: Packaging of one item into the shipping unit.
>>> SPMFactIVEnablePackagingClose: Closing of the packaging of the shipping unit.

If autoreload function is enabled, then shift production plans are regenerated periodically unconditionally, or to reflect the changes in the underlying EWS.
>>> SPMPlanAutoModeOn: Shift Production Plan automatic reload enable (true/false).
>>> SPMPlanEwsModeRefreshOnChangeOnly=True: Shift Production Plan auto reload only when EWS changes.
>>> SPMPlanEwsModeReloadFrequency: Shift Production Plan reload frequency.

When EWS starts shift production plans are generated with the assumption about the content of the assembly line.
>>> SPMPlanEwsModeOn=True: Shift Production Plan is generated using EWS data.
>>> SPMPlanEwsModeOn=False: Shift Production Plan is entered directly, no EWS info is used.
>>> SPMPlanEwsModeIniToEmpty=True: Assumes empty assembly line when creating shift production plan at EWS start.
>>> SPMPlanEwsModeIniToEmpty=False: Assumes full (with the first item of the EWS) assembly line when creating shift production plan at EWS start.
>>>PCPackITSNrescanfrequency: No repetitive Packaging and PackagingClose interventions are accepted for the same harness within this time (format=hh:mm:ss).

Setting.DisplayName: Shift Production Plan auto relode enable
Setting.SettingDescription: Shift Production Plan auto relode enable.

Setting.DisplayName: Shift Production Plan relode on EWS change only
Setting.SettingDescription: Shift Production Plan relode on EWS change only.

Setting.DisplayName: Shift Production Plan EWS mode reload frequency
Setting.SettingDescription: Shift Production Plan EWS mode reload frequency.

Setting.DisplayName: Generate Shift Production Plan using e-worksheet
Setting.SettingDescription: Generate Shift Production Plan using e-worksheet.

Setting.DisplayName: Generate Shift Production Plan assuming empty assembly line
Setting.SettingDescription: Generate Shift Production Plan assuming empty assembly line.

Setting.DisplayName: Deaf periode for SPM packaging interventions
Setting.SettingDescription: Deaf periode for SPM packaging interventions.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
Andon function setting.

 The parameters:
>>> UseMasterData = recieved ANDON request codes will be checked against ALM Master Data (true/false).
>>> StopRequestCode = The request code for the assembly line stop request.
>>> ShiftChangeAction = what should happen with the active requests at shift change (Nothing=no action, requests remain active, but will be related to the closing shift, Init=all active requests will be cleared, Move=active requests will remain active, but will be transferred to the starting shift).
>>> AndonViewOnTimer = Andon data display ON on the ASEMonitor screen (sev).
>>> AndonViewOffTimer = Andon data display OFF on the ASEMonitor screen (sev).
>>> ASE LogicalName = the logical name of the ASE terminal the Andon controller is connected to(Start/End).
>>> ASE ComPort = the COM port of the ASE terminal where the Andon controller is connected to (1/2).
>>> Acknowledge = this string is sent to the Andon controller as a confirmation to the recieved Andon intervention.
>>> NegativeAcknowledge = this string is sent to the Andon controller as a rejection to the recieved Andon intervention.
>>> AndonControllerInitSequence = this string is sent to the Andon controller when initializing the Andon system.
>>> Within the strings the non-alphanumeric characters are indicated by \xHH or \XXX, where HH is the 2 digits hexadecimal code of the byte, XXX the ASCII name of the byte:
>>> 0-9: NUL,SOH,STX,ETX,EOT,ENQ,ACK,BEL,BS,TAB;
>>> 10-20:LF,VT,FF,CR,SO,SI,DLE,DC1,DC2,DC3,DC4;
>>> 21-31:NAK,SYSN,ETB,CAN,EM,SUB,ESC,FS,GS,RS,US;
>>> 127:DEL.
>>> QueueStopRequests = true: stores stop requests in the request queue.
>>> MaxNumOfWP = Maximum number of workplaces per assembly line that can be displayed on the monitor screens.
>>> MaxLenWPqueue = Maximum number of requests per workplace to display on the monitor screens.
>>> MaxNumOfCode = Maximum number of request codes that can be displayed on the monitor screens.
>>> MaxLenCodeQueue = Maximum number of requests per request types to display on the monitor screens.

Setting.DisplayName: ANDON request checking with Master Data
Setting.SettingDescription: ANDON request checking with Master Data.

Setting.DisplayName: Init byte sequence to the Andon controller
Setting.SettingDescription: Init byte sequence to the Andon controller.

Setting.DisplayName: Length of Andon display ON on the ASE Monitor
Setting.SettingDescription: Length of Andon display ON on the ASE Monitor.

Setting.DisplayName: Length of Andon display OFF on the ASE Monitor
Setting.SettingDescription: Length of Andon display OFF on the ASE Monitor.

Setting.DisplayName: Positive acknoledgement sent to the Andon controller
Setting.SettingDescription: Positive acknoledgement sent to the Andon controller.

Setting.DisplayName: Negative acknoledgement sent to the Andon controller
Setting.SettingDescription: Negative acknoledgement sent to the Andon controller.

Setting.DisplayName: Name of the ASE terminal connected to the Anndon controller
Setting.SettingDescription: Name of the ASE terminal connected to the Anndon controller.

Setting.DisplayName: COM port of the ASE terminal connected to the Anndon controller
Setting.SettingDescription: COM port of the ASE terminal connected to the Anndon controller.
Maximum number of workplaces per assembly line that can be displayed on the monitor screens.

Setting.DisplayName: Maximum number of requests per workplace
Setting.SettingDescription: Maximum number of requests per workplace.
Maximum number of request codes that can be displayed on the monitor screens.

Setting.DisplayName: Maximum number of requests per request types
Setting.SettingDescription: Maximum number of requests per request types.

SettingGroup.GroupHelp:
These are the parameters of the Efficiency metric (SDLH=Standard Lear Hours, PTU=Production Time Utilization, IPPM = Internal Parts Per Million) calculation function.

>>> EfficiencyMetricCalculationOperation=started|completed|packed|closed: this is the operation of what the quantities are used for the efficiency calculation.
>>> IPPMstd: the global standard value for IPPM.
>>> RefreshInterval: the refresh periode for the efficiency metric recalculation (in seconds).

Setting.DisplayName: Use this operation in metrics calculation
Setting.SettingDescription: Use this operation in metrics calculation.
